title.native: アルスラーン戦記 風塵乱舞
title.english: The Heroic Legend of Arslan: Dust Storm Dance

description:
After managing to get past the battles concerning the royal successor for Sindhura, Arslan and company made their triumphal return to Pars to find Hilmes the brave general with the silver mask standing in their way. And by the time they somehow get Hilmes to stand down and they can be on their way to thee capital once again, an even larger threat was fast approaching the land of Pars.

(Source: Anime News Network)

title.native: アルスラーン戦記 風塵乱舞 アル戦4コマ劇場

node.description:
Novelist. Not to be confused with [Yoshiki Tanaka (田中克樹)](https://anilist.co/staff/117267).

Yoshiki Tanaka was born in 1952 in Kumamoto Prefecture and completed a doctorate in literature at Gakushuin University. Tanaka won the Gen’eijo (a mystery magazine) New Writer Award with his debut story “Midori no Sogen ni…” (On the green field…) in 1978, then started his carrier as a science fiction and fantasy writer. Legend of the Galactic Heroes, which translates the European wars of the nineteenth century to an interstellar setting, won the Seiun Award for best science fiction novel in 1987. Tanaka’s other works include the fantasy series The Heroic Legend of Arslan and many other science fiction, fantasy, historical, and mystery novels and stories

Her self-portrait is usually that of a bespectacled cow, as she was born and raised in a dairy farm with three older sisters and a younger brother. Arakawa started out as [Etou Hiroyuki's](https://anilist.co/staff/98901/) assistant writer for [Mahoujin Guru Guru](https://anilist.co/manga/34080/) and a friend of [Shakugan no Shana](https://anilist.co/manga/33074/) author [Yashichiro Takahashi](https://anilist.co/staff/99114/). Arakawa's career started with a work titled [STRAY DOG](https://anilist.co/manga/33303/), but she is best known for creating the [Fullmetal Alchemist](https://anilist.co/manga/30025/) world and manga. The author is friends with [Akira Segami](https://anilist.co/staff/97387/).

Due to a lack of real publicity photos of Arakawa, a great sum of her fanbase has no idea what she really looks like, even to this day. There are some scarce pictures of the real Arakawa in the web, but they are very low in quality and are rarely used as reference. Many fans have mistaken photos of [Romi Park](https://anilist.co/staff/95082/Romi-Park), Edward Elric's seiyuu, as photos of Arakawa, because of the set-up in one particular image in which Romi Park poses as a mangaka. Romi Park is known for representing Arakawa in public appearances, in which Arakawa is not able to attend. 

_Awards:_
• 1999: 9th 21st Century Enix Award for "Stray Dog"
• 2003: 49th Shogakukan Manga Award, Shōnen category for "Fullmetal Alchemist"
• 2011: 15th Tezuka Osamu Cultural Prize, "New Artist Prize" category.
• 2011: 42nd Seiun Award, "Best Science Fiction Comic" category for "Fullmetal Alchemist"
• 2012: 5th Manga Taishō Award for "Silver Spoon"
• 2012: 58th Shogakukan Manga Award, Shōnen category for "Silver Spoon"
• 2013: 1st Contents Award of Japan Food Culture Grand Prize for "Silver Spoon"
• 2023: 1st Rakuten Kobo's E-Book Manga Award, "I Want to Read it Now! Featured Manga" category for "Yomi no Tsugai"
• 2023: 7th Tsutaya Comic Award for "Yomi no Tsugai"

[Wiki (jp)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/明田川仁)

Affiliated with Magic Capsule, a recording studio led by his father [Susumu Aketagawa](https://anilist.co/staff/120062).

[Official Website ](https://www.aoieir.com/) | [Twitter ](https://twitter.com/eir_ruru) | [YouTube ](https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCZ7B1oCEDT_d4c9XTtChX7w) | [Instagram ](https://www.instagram.com/aoieir/) | [Spotify ](https://open.spotify.com/artist/18moNotPmBWa2YZtRnIoZ3?autoplay=true)

Aoi Eir is a Japanese pop singer signed to SME Records. She was discovered through Nico Nico Douga video sharing network. Like other Nico Nico Douga artists, not much of her personal information is revealed.   

Eir has loved singing since she was a child, at high school period, she sung in a band she had formed. After graduating from high school, she gave up her music career but continued performing publicly. Her impressive and beautiful voice are easily recognizable and she has been selected to sing the closing song for TV animation “Fate/Zero” which was released as her debut single called “MEMORIA” on October 19, 2011.

[Official Website](http://www.kalafina.jp/) | [Twitter](https://twitter.com/kalafina_staff) | [YouTube](https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCnRbD__LEKBj_ZR_dC8KmzQ)

Kalafina were a Japanese band formed by composer [Yuki Kajiura](https://anilist.co/staff/100077/Yuki-Kajiura) in 2007 to mainly perform theme songs for the [Kara no Kyoukai](https://anilist.co/anime/2593/Kara-no-Kyoukai-Fukan-Fuukei/) anime movies, but since expanded to many other theme songs for other anime shows and films.

Main vocals and backgrounds are provided by a different member each time. For example, Wakana is in charge of the main vocals in Oblivious and Lacrimosa, while the main vocals in Aria are done by Hikaru. In others songs each of them sings a stanza. Wakana and Keiko are also members of Yuki Kajiura's [FictionJunction](https://anilist.co/staff/103691/FictionJunction) project. 

Spacecraft agency officially announced disbandment on March 13, 2019 after Kajiura, Keiko, and Hikaru left the agency in 2018.

In January 2025, the three members will reunite for the first time in six years to hold "Kalafina Anniversary LIVE 2025" at the Tokyo Garden Theater, with Takebe Satoshi serving as musical director.

__Members:__
• [Yuki Kajiura](https://anilist.co/staff/100077/) (梶浦由記) - Composer

• Keiko - [Keiko Kubota](https://anilist.co/staff/104664/) (窪田啓子/ケイコ) - Vocalist
• Wakana - Wakana Ootaki (大滝若奈/ワカナ) - Vocalist
• Hikaru - [Hikaru Masai](https://anilist.co/staff/168857/) (政井光/ヒカル) - Vocalist

• Maya Toyoshima (豊島摩耶) - Vocalist, participated only in "ARIA"/"sprinter", left the group in 2009

__Support:__
• Remi Tanaka (田中玲美/REMI) - Background vocalist
• [Yuriko Kaida](https://anilist.co/staff/103489/) (貝田由里子) - Background vocalist
• Hanae Tomaru (戸丸華江) - Background vocalist

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/yujikaneko)

Founder and representative director of Aoshashin.

__Machida Touko__ is a Japanese script/screenwriter and series composer.

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/sakuribo)
